lines.text: I can't ever marry you.
But why not? Why can't you?
Because I'm bad.
You bad? Why, Roseanna, I think you're lear out of your mind.
Maybe it's that... or bewitched.
But I thought you said you... you said you like me to put my arms around you.

[Hugging him]
To hold me and hide me. Oh, if it could only be. But I'd bring destruction to you, Thad. You'd catch it from me like a fever.
Catch what?
The misery, the wickedness. Let's get on back to the house and when we get there you go off, Thad, and never think of me no more. Never no more.

[Kissing him for the first time]
Oh, Johnsie... Johnsie.
I thought you'd never come out.
I was so afraid.
Of me?
I thought I was so bad. I thought maybe you put some charm on me. I tried to think you weren't here a callin'.
But you ain't afraid no more?
Oh, no... no.
Oh, my darling. My dear.
[They embrace]
You talk so wild.
You make me wild.

[Directed to Hatfield kin]
You heard the bad things he said of me. And now he wants to start trouble and kill my folks. All because Johnsie and me love each other.
[to Devil]

But that don't matter to you 'cause you don't know what it is to love anybody. You don't want him to be happy. You don't want him to be kind and good to folks. You want to make him like you are. You want hate and wickedness to go on and on 'til he's as bad and hard and cruel and miserable as you. Standin' in the way like a mean old dog when we was wishin' everyone to be happy like we were. But you won't spoil us. You won't. You won't!

[to Mounts]
You poor, miserable, twisted varmint.

[to one of her sons]
Don't talk with your knife in your mouth.
You heard about your brother gettin' hurt?
Yes, I saw them at the fort.
Is he gonna get better?
No.
It's my fault. I brought the bad luck. I'll bring it on everyone.
I don't hold to that talk.

Don't touch me. I thought it was enough to love you but it ain't. There's things stronger than love. There's hate and wickedness all around. They won't let anything good happen. I want to go home. I want to go home.
Nothing's strong than us. There's ho hate in us... only love.
It's not enough.
If the whole world was on fire I wouldn't care. I've been feelin' all day like I was cut in half 'cause I wasn't with ya. You're the same as me. I don't care how you talk. You'r the same as me.
[He kisses her]
Tell me, Roseanna. Tell me you're the same.
You go on home and I'll come and face up to your pa. Tell him I love you and the preacher's comin' to Thad's store and we're gonna be married.
What if he says "no?"
There ain't a big enough "no."

[Looking out the window after his daughter reappears and tells him she is in love with a Hatfield]
Lord, I prayed to you all last night that the lightnin' mightn't a blackened her, nor a bear nor a panther married her. And you granted my prayer. I served you all the days of my life, the best I know'd how. My fault, Lord. I failed you.

[to Johnsie during gunfire]
You're a Hatfield now... if you want to get out of her alive.
Pa, say you'll do him no harm when he comes here. If you love me just a bit, pa.
I'm no murderin' savage. I'll not harm him.

[to the Hatfield men while standing over her wounded little brother]
Shootin' a boy. You're not men, none of ya. You got the face of a wolf pack fixed for killin' and nothin' else.
[to Johnse]

And you look the same. Why don't you shoot me? I'm bigger than Randall and I hate you more than he does. I hate the day my eyes first saw ya. I hate every word I've spoken to ya. I hate ya for everything you've done to me.
I'll help you with him.
Take your bloody Hatfield hands off him!

[after a pause]
Alright, hate then. That's all I want out of ya. Hate and nothin' else.
